title: La Pitchoune 2013 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a tremendous vineyard location known for its meticulous farming, this wine was made in small quantities. It exemplifies balance, pitting creamy, voluptuous texture against crisp apple and guava, the acidity never ceding entirely to the oak.

title: Oakville East 2013 Frank 'N Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)
description: This wine is a majority varietal, a rare find in the appellation. Dusty mocha and softly integrated, bittersweet tannin accent a full-bodied texture and body weight, while perfumed wisps of cedar and violet play off the nose.

title: Opolo 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: An inviting nose of red currant, violet, lilac and strawberry-laced crème brûlée entices immediately. The palate is framed by wild thyme and sagebrush that decorate charcoal, leather, dark chocolate and roast lamb touches, before finishing on a soft strawberry note.

title: Pagos del Rey 2012 Arnegui Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry and oak-based coconut aromas include notes of molasses and baked black plum. This is composed and balanced on the palate, with flavors of dark fruits, integrated oak, vanilla and pepper. On the finish, vanilla, tobacco and herbal notes complement dry, crisp tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Panther Creek 2014 Schindler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The Schindler is a dark and chewy wine, with forward flavors of black cherry fruit. There's a streak of stem and dried herb, as the black fruit flavors push into a medium-long finish. The acids turn slightly chalky as the finish resolves.

title: Steininger 2014 Brut Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A fragrant nose unites notes of candied lime peel, hay flowers, savory yeast and apple. The same complex, rounded and rich flavours are present on the smooth, creamy palate which nonetheless has a firm backbone of freshness and an autolytic frame reminiscent of bread crust. With all its body and restrained dosage this is more suitable as a food partner than as an apéritif.

title: Stephen Vincent 2013 Crimson Republica de'California Red (California)
description: An affordably priced wine brings meaty, peppery aromas, interesting fruit, spice and smoke flavors, and a mouthcoating texture. It is full bodied, complex and concentrated.

title: Stift Klosterneuburg NV Klostersekt Brut Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Soft notes of hay and chalk appear on the nose, nuanced with a hint of lemon. The palate follows with the same flavor-base, majoring on yeast rather than fruit in an elegant, grown-up way. The foam is soft, the finish is dry but utterly refreshing, leaving you with a lasting lemon note.

title: Redbank 2013 The Long Paddock Shiraz (Victoria)
description: This is peppery and floral on the nose, then red fruited and spicy on the palate. It's supple but structured, picking up a dusting of cocoa on the mocha-tinged finish.

title: René Muré NV Cuvée Prestige Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: The scent of hay flowers mingles with lifted, translucent impressions of lemons, green apples and lime. On the palate, these fresh notes are balanced by unobtrusive tastes of bread and very light, fragrant blossom honey. Together they are playful, light and joyous, dispersing their flavor in a thousand tiny bursting bubbles. This is light but serious, weightless but impressive while the finish is completely dry.

title: Tiziano Mazzoni 2012 Dei Mazzoni  (Ghemme)
description: Leather, ripe dark-skinned berry, chopped herb, rose and a balsamic note are some of the aromas you'll find on this. The austere palate offers tart red cherry, sour cranberry, sage and a hint of anise alongside firm tannins. Give it time to fully develop. Drink after 2022.

title: Santos & Seixo 2013 Santos da Casa Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Oak-aged for 18 months, this concentrated wine is perfumed, rich and densely textured. Firm tannins still abound in this solidly structured wine. The blackberry fruit is still young although likely to be finely balanced as the wine matures. Drink this serious wine from 2018.

title: Pride Mountain 2013 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)
description: Bottled in a dessert-like bottle, this wine is entirely dry, blended with 24% Merlot and aged in French oak. Dark raspberry flavor surrounds a tannic core accented in cedar, dried herb and smoky oak, the finish soft and smooth.

title: Pfendler 2015 Estate Grown Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: A pale salmon color leads to cherry and herb aromas and flavors, with a crisp, even lightly astringent mouthfeel that is good and appetizing. This wine is dry, medium bodied and fresh.

title: Pisoni 2012 Brut Metodo Classico Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of candied nectarine zest, chamomile, bread dough and a whiff of thyme lead the nose. The ripe round palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, hazelnut and a hint of bread crust alongside a soft perlage.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2015 Schiefer Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: Stone and steel define this deeply mineral, dry Riesling. It's elegantly fruity as well though, with zesty lime, lemon and grapefruit flavors brightening the palate. Silky and languorous, it finishes on a lingering honeycomb note.

title: Gilberto Boniperti 2012 Barton  (Fara)
description: Made with 70% Nebbiolo and 30% Vespolina, this vibrant red offers enticing, ethereal scents of perfumed berry, fragrant blue flower, aromatic herb and a whiff of cedar. The mid-weight, luminous palate delivers crushed red cherry, raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper. Racy acidity lifts the finish while polished tannins provides support.

title: Global Wines 2014 Grilos Reserva Red (Dão)
description: A concentrated blend of Touriga Nacional, Jaén and Tinta Roriz, this is a rich wine, spicy and densely textured. It has concentration to balance the broad black fruits and acidity. Age this wine for a year and drink from 2017.

title: Epiphany 2013 Revelation Rodney's Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This mix of 68% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 12% Petite Sirah offers blackberry jam, lavender and cracked pepper on the nose. Tart berries show on the sip, made more serious with a tarry structure and lifted by light purple flowers and an incense element that carries through the finish.

title: Hope Estate 2013 Basalt Block Shiraz (Hunter Valley)
description: This is already showing some evolution in its color, displaying some lightening at its rim. The aromas are floral and tea-like, with subtle cinnamon and spice shadings, and the flavors follow along, resembling Wild Berry Zinger tea. It's medium in weight, with silky tannins and a softly dusty finish.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Spätlese Cuvée White (Burgenland)
description: Fragrant notes of candied pear and lifted hints of orange blossom are tempered by exuberant lemon freshness. The palate is of tender, enveloping but not overbearing sweetness, carrying aloft an exquisite, honeyed tableau of pear and quince, mirabelle plum and apricot, balanced by pure lemon freshness. The finish is soft, moreish and mellow.

title: Kimsey 2013 White (Ballard Canyon)
description: From one of the young appellation's newer vineyards comes this blend of 74% Roussanne and 26% Viognier. Made in a slightly reductive style, it has sour aromas of orange rind, citrus pith and a touch of quinine. Lime skins and yogurt elements show on the palate, which is lifted by jasmine flowers and dried nectarine.

title: Fenestra 2011 Touriga Nacional (Livermore Valley)
description: Try this bold and concentrated wine for a change of pace. Enormous aromas of fully ripe plums and cherries mix with savory, herbal accents. The flavors are rich and mouthfilling, dripping with prune, boysenberry and anise.

title: Ferrari 2009 Perlé Rosé Metodo Classico Sparkling (Trento)
description: Creamy and crisp, this slowly reveals delicate scents of small red berry and Alpine herb. The bright polished palate offers strawberry, apple, nectarine and a hint of bread crust alongside fresh acidity and an elegant mousse. A mineral note backs up the finish.

title: Domaine Fernand Engel NV Brut Chardonnay (Alsace)
description: Seductively rich notes of peach and yellow plum entice the nose. They also bathe the palate in a very luscious light, counteracted by fresh mousse and balancing, taut freshness. This is a lovely synthesis of rich fruit and dry restraint, fizzing away with pleasure. The finish is long, dry and lemony.

title: Domaine Fernand Engel NV Tradition Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: Appetizing notes of apple and yellow plum reach the nose. The palate is fizzing with freshness and redolent of fresh red-apple peel with overtones of honey. The mousse is creamy and accentuates the dry refreshing finish.

title: Le Pianelle 2012  Bramaterra
description: A blend of Nebbiolo, Vespolina and Croatina, this opens with aromas of aromatic herb, wild berry, menthol and a floral note. The firm, vibrant palate offers tar, sour cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside youthfully austere, fine-grained tannins. This needs time to soften up and fully develop. Drink 2019–2027.

title: Dopff & Irion NV Cuvée Prestige Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: Green citrus is aligned with green apple on the nose. The zesty, crisp and utterly refreshing notes fill the palate while the soft mousse fizzes away, underlining the balanced, dry freshness even more. The body is light and the green apple and citrus notes, cushioned by lovely biscuit notes, last all the way to an echoing, dry finish.

title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2015 Blitz Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pretty blossom and apricot aromas bolster ripe, rich flavors of honey tangerine and yellow peach in this forward, fruity wine. There's no pretense here: It's a hedonistic guzzler of a wine, but its tangy salt-and-lime finish makes it hard to resist another glass. Drink while young.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Taylor's Vineyard Musque Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Named for the proprietor's daughter, Taylor's is stainless-steel fermented and meant to exude juicy waves of pear, apple and lemon, a fully immersive expression of fruit and minerality. Well balanced, it shows a tease of peach fuzz and the crispness of never having met a swath of oak.
